org.jcvi.jillion.sam

Interface SamParser


  • public interface SamParser
    SamParser is an interface that can parse SAM or BAM files and call the appropriate methods on the given SamVisitor.
    Author:
    dkatzel
    See Also:
    SamParserFactory

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  SamParser.SamParserOptions

    • Method Detail

      • canParse

        boolean canParse()
        Can this handler accept new parse requests via the various parse() methods. Some implementations of SamParser may only allow one parse call in its lifetime (for example, if the sam structure is being parsed via an InputStream).
        Returns:
        true if this handler can handle new parse requests; false otherwise.

      • parse

        void parse(SamVisitor visitor)
    throws IOException
        Parse the Sam or Bam file and and call the appropriate visit methods on the given SamVisitor.
        Parameters:
        visitor - the SamVisitor to call the visit methods on; can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem parsing the sam or bam file.
        NullPointerException - if visitor is null.

      • parse

        void parse(SamVisitor visitor,
           SamVisitor.SamVisitorCallback.SamVisitorMemento memento)
    throws IOException
        Parse the Sam or Bam file and starting from the offset of the provided memento and call the appropriate visit methods on the given SamVisitor.
        Parameters:
        visitor - the SamVisitor to call the visit methods on; can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem parsing the sam or bam file.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the memento is invalid for this SamParser instance (wrong file, wrong parser implementation etc).

      • parse

        void parse(String referenceName,
           SamVisitor visitor)
    throws IOException
        Parse the Sam or Bam file and but only visit the SamRecords that map to the given reference.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name of the Reference to visit the mapped records of; can not be null.
        visitor - the SamVisitor to call the visit methods on; can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem parsing the sam or bam file.
        NullPointerException - if either referenceName or visitor are null.
        Since:
        5.0

      • parse

        void parse(String referenceName,
           Range alignmentRange,
           SamVisitor visitor)
    throws IOException
        Parse the Sam or Bam file and but only visit the SamRecords that map to the given reference and the read alignment intersects the reference to the provided Range.
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name of the Reference to visit the mapped records of; can not be null.
        alignmentRange - the Range on the Reference to visit the mapped records of; can not be null.
        visitor - the SamVisitor to call the visit methods on; can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem parsing the sam or bam file.
        NullPointerException - if any parameters are null.
        Since:
        5.0

      • parse

        void parse(SamParser.SamParserOptions options,
           SamVisitor visitor)
    throws IOException
        Parse the Sam or Bam file and but only visit the SamRecords that map to the given reference and the read alignment intersects the reference to the provided Range.
        Parameters:
        options - the name of the Reference to visit the mapped records of; can not be null.
        visitor - the SamVisitor to call the visit methods on; can not be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem parsing the sam or bam file.
        NullPointerException - if any parameters are null.
        Since:
        5.3

      • getHeader

        SamHeader getHeader()
             throws IOException
        Get the SamHeader for this SAM or BAM file.
        API Note:
        some SamParser implementations may cache the header parsed from the file so this calling this method is usually preferable than getting the header via one of the parse methods and then halting parsing.
        Returns:
        a SamHeader object; will never be null but may be empty if there is no header information in the sam or bam file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem (re)parsing the header.
